body:
# **Presentation at New Worlds Conference****Abstract:** 

MoonDao contributor Ari Eisenstat is invited to speak at ****[The New Worlds Conference](https://www.eventcreate.com/e/new-worlds). This program is hosted by the Foundation for the Future and Earthlight Foundation with partner organizations such as the National Space Society, Space for Humanity, Space Frontier Foundation, The Mars Society. This conference features astronauts, NASA officials, space executives, nonprofit leaders, and academic researchers in Austin, Texas on October 28th and 29th. 

**_Motivation:_** 

The motivations behind this project are to continue to represent MoonDAO as a permanent presence in the space community, to engage space leaders in MoonDAO, build organizational partners in MoonDao, and conduct research on the future of humanity in space. 

**_Specification:_**  

Ari Eisenstat is an Instructor at the University of Hawai’i Research Center for Future Studies and co-facilitated the United Nations Association of the United States of America Outer Space Innovation and Advocacy Series. In his research he designed an interactive survey on the future of Outer Space Policy. Ari moderated a panel at the New Worlds conference where he met MoonDao founders as well as the leaders of the New Worlds Conference. 

One of those leaders is [Rick Tumlinson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rick_Tumlinson), who spoke with Ari and invited him to present his research and a Space Citizen Survey in the introduction of the New Worlds Institute for the opening session of the conference. The next day, he will present the results in the lunch session after a keynote by Dr. Chris Boshuizen who is a Private Astronaut with Blue Origin and founder of Planet Labs. The video of the presentations and reports may be published through MoonDao social media and on UNA-USA channels. 

__**_Benefits:_**  

Benefits include building relationships with individuals and groups in the space industry, creating media for digital outreach, and hosting academic research and space advocacy initiatives. 

**_Risks:_** 

Possible travel uncertainty in flight cancellation, however Ari will be leaving early enough to reschedule.`

`


## **Objectives and Key Results:**

[If you are unfamiliar with OKRs please read this article on how to write effective OKRs ](https://rework.withgoogle.com/guides/set-goals-with-okrs/steps/introduction/)

[Project scorecard ](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Ng0UuwHrnurkRbi-joJBsYjdNSRl60AmO1pL1CpKkKA/edit?usp=sharing)

You can write as many OKRs as you think are needed. One OKR is fine if that captures the full extent of what you want to achieve. One focused goal is preferred instead of many.

**Objective #1:** Present and Publish Space Citizen Survey and Results and publish MoonDAO as a model fundraising and facilitation body for space projects__**Key Results for Objective #1**: 

- A permanent video of the presentation

- Academic and Advocacy Report__

**Objective #2:** Recruit veteran space community members into MoonDAO

**Key Results for Objective #2**: 

_-_ Inspire individuals to become contributors to MoonDAO

**Objective #3:** Explore Organizational Partnerships

**Key Results for Objective #3**: 

_-_ Research options for partnership in growth, technology, and the space program


## __**Team Table (Table A)**

_There can be a maximum of two team stewards, both must be a Moonsettler or above for at least a month, unless there is an exception made by an Astronaut. Project teams may not even need an initial team. It can just be an individual submitting a proposal. As a general rule of thumb, try to keep teams small and focused in the beginning, with clear deliverables and OKRs for each member. Reach out to a sponsor to help you put together the proposal to avoid having to redo any work. Multisig signers should include two astronauts, and as a rule of thumb the rest should be either trusted members in the DAO, or the project stewards._

|                                                  |            |
| ------------------------------------------------ | ---------- |
| **Project Stewards**                             | Ari        |
| **Initial Team**                                 | Ari        |
| **Sponsors**                                     | _pmoncada_ |
| **Foreign Language Representatives (optional)**  |            |
| **Multi-sig Signers (if Budget is needed)**      |            |


### **Initial Team Bios (one for each):** 

**Team Member #1: AriBruce _https\://www\.linkedin.com/in/ari-eisenstat/_**

**_Bio:_** 

_Ari Eisenstat is an International Futurist at the University of Hawai’i - Research Center for Future Studies and Matsunaga Institute for Peace & Conflict Resolution Human Rights Instructor exploring ‘The Future of Outer Space Policy for Sustainable Development.’ Ari facilitates Outer Space Innovation and Advocacy programs through the United Nations Association-USA, Nexus Global Summit, and UH Astrobiology Institute featuring Astronauts, UN Office of Outer Space Affairs Officials, Elected Representatives, New Space Industry Leaders, and Civil Society Experts. With experience in the public, private, and nonprofit sectors, Ari has lectured at United Nations Agencies in New York, Geneva, and Vienna, UN Climate Change Conferences in Marrakech and Bonn, World Summit of Nobel Peace Laureates in Bogota and Merida, as well as universities such as Harvard, Stanford, MIT, Penn, Duke, UC Berkeley, NYU, and globally. Ari engages in experiential education, strategic advising, venture philanthropy, impact investing, and creative media for leading edge projects._

**_Role:_** _Presenter_

_Team Member Minimum Viable Payment (optional): $2000_

**Budget Justifications (Table B)**

_These might include bounties that you’ll make inside of the DAO, or specific work that must be contracted out to complete the project. This contracted out work can be in the form of Bounties. Don’t include salaries for the team, the team will get rewarded with Coordinape after the project is over._

|                  |          |                                     |

| Total            | $1744.44 | Not including other expenses        |

**Total Budget (including guaranteed payments to team members):** 

**$1,744.44 Dai**

**$2,000 USD to $MOONEY = 524,286.6**


## **Estimated Project Timeline (Table C)**

_These just need to be a rough timeline of milestones for the project. This is mostly intended to help you put together an idea of the work that needs to get done and when you hope to finish each deliverable._

| ------------------ | ---------------------------------- |

| Oct 30, 2022       | Return to Honolulu                 |
| The following week | Report on Project Success          |


## **Deadline for the project: 1st of November, 2022**

****


## **Report from Ari Eisenstat**

**It was an honor to represent MoonDao at the New Worlds Conference in Austin, Texas from October 27-29, 2022. Aside from the water being shut off in my hotel on the last day, the mission was a great success. I was able to connect with most of the fantastic attendees there and share about MoonDao.** 

**The objectives of presenting, recruiting MoonDao members, and exploring organizational partnerships were met. The Space Citizen Survey video link is below and results will be published in my United Nations Association Outer Space Innovation and Advocacy Report as well as my PhD Dissertation on Outer Space Policy.** 

**In addition to my opening remarks on the first day and lunch workshop on the second, MoonDao received an excellent shoutout by Sean Graham in the Crypto panel discussion. Sean is the leader of Earthlight Foundation and Karman Line and has been an excellent addition to the MoonDao team as an individual and institutional partner. We are looking forward to working with him and his team on upcoming proposals for the Zero G Yuris Night Event, Davos Delegation, and more!**

**Another leader who has joined MoonDao is Ben Haldeman who is the founder of Lifeship, which is a space-time capsule program to send DNA and Data to space. They have a payload on a lunar lander in 2024 and I have been working with him on a** [**proposal**](https://discord.com/channels/914720248140279868/1043060555398791228) **for MoonDao to partner.** 

**Some other highlights were connecting with Astronaut Greg Chamitoff and learning about his engineering program,** [**https://www.space-teams.com**](https://www.space-teams.com)**. I will be following up with him in January.** 

**Also, Jayne Pointer the CEO of** [**https://spaceperspective.com**](https://spaceperspective.com) **was a great speaker and they are partners with Space for Humanity, which we are also developing a proposal on a flight to space.**

**There are many other individuals and organizations that I connected with and am following up with through the Space Engineering and Growth Guilds. Below are some other highlights. Thank you all for the support!**
